base_url.description: This is the target GitLab base API endpoint. Providing a value is a requirement when working with GitLab CE or GitLab Enterprise e.g. `https://my.gitlab.server/api/v4/`. It is optional to provide this value and it can also be sourced from the `GITLAB_BASE_URL` environment variable. The value must end with a slash.

cacert_file.description: This is a file containing the ca cert to verify the gitlab instance. This is available for use when working with GitLab CE or Gitlab Enterprise with a locally-issued or self-signed certificate chain.

client_cert.description: File path to client certificate when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data.

client_key.description: File path to client key when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data. Required when `client_cert` is set.

early_auth_check.description: (Experimental) By default the provider does a dummy request to get the current user in order to verify that the provider configuration is correct and the GitLab API is reachable. Turn it off, to skip this check. This may be useful if the GitLab instance does not yet exist and is created within the same terraform module. This is an experimental feature and may change in the future. Please make sure to always keep backups of your state.

insecure.description: When set to true this disables SSL verification of the connection to the GitLab instance.

token.description: The OAuth2 Token, Project, Group, Personal Access Token or CI Job Token used to connect to GitLab. The OAuth method is used in this provider for authentication (using Bearer authorization token). See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/#authentication for details. It may be sourced from the `GITLAB_TOKEN` environment variable.

can_push.description: Bool, true if you can push to the branch.

commit.description: The commit associated with the branch ref.

default.description: Bool, true if branch is the default branch for the project.

developer_can_merge.description: Bool, true if developer level access allows to merge branch.

developer_can_push.description: Bool, true if developer level access allows git push.

merged.description: Bool, true if the branch has been merged into it's parent.

project.description: The ID or full path of the project which the branch is created against.

protected.description: Bool, true if branch has branch protection.

ref.description: The ref which the branch is created from.

web_url.description: The url of the created branch (https).

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage GitLab branches.

allow_force_push.description: Can be set to true to allow users with push access to force push.

branch_protection_id.description: The ID of the branch protection (not the branch name).

code_owner_approval_required.description: Can be set to true to require code owner approval before merging.

merge_access_level.description: Access levels allowed to merge. Valid values are: `no one`, `developer`, `maintainer`.

project.description: The id of the project.

push_access_level.description: Access levels allowed to push. Valid values are: `no one`, `developer`, `maintainer`.

access_level_description.description: Readable description of level of access.

group_id.description: The ID of a GitLab group allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `user_id`.

user_id.description: The ID of a GitLab user allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `group_id`.

block.description: Defines permissions for action.

access_level_description.description: Readable description of level of access.

group_id.description: The ID of a GitLab group allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `user_id`.

user_id.description: The ID of a GitLab user allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `group_id`.

block.description: Defines permissions for action.

This resource allows you to protect a specific branch by an access level so that the user with less access level cannot Merge/Push to the branch.

-> The `allowed_to_push`, `allowed_to_merge` and `code_owner_approval_required` arguments require a GitLab Premium account or above.  Please refer to [Gitlab API documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/protected_branches.html) for further information.

can_push.description: Allow this deploy key to be used to push changes to the project.  Defaults to `false`. **NOTE::** this cannot currently be managed.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the deploy key to.

title.description: A title to describe the deploy key with.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage [deploy keys](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/deploy_keys/) for your GitLab projects.

can_push.description: Can deploy key push to the project’s repository.

key_id.description: The Gitlab key id for the pre-existing deploy key

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the deploy key to.

block.description:
This resource allows you to enable pre-existing deploy keys for your GitLab projects.

> **NOTE**: the GITLAB KEY_ID for the deploy key must be known

expires_at.description: Time the token will expire it, RFC3339 format. Will not expire per default.

group.description: The name or id of the group to add the deploy token to.

name.description: A name to describe the deploy token with.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the deploy token to.

token.description: The secret token. This is only populated when creating a new deploy token.

username.description: A username for the deploy token. Default is `gitlab+deploy-token-{n}`.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage deploy token for your GitLab projects and groups. Please refer to [Gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/deploy_tokens/) for further information.

auto_devops_enabled.description: Boolean, defaults to false.  Default to Auto

emails_disabled.description: Boolean, defaults to false.  Disable email notifications

full_name.description: The full name of the group.

full_path.description: The full path of the group.

lfs_enabled.description: Boolean, defaults to true.  Whether to enable LFS

mentions_disabled.description: Boolean, defaults to false.  Disable the capability

parent_id.description: Integer, id of the parent group (creates a nested group).

request_access_enabled.description: Boolean, defaults to false.  Whether to

runners_token.description: The group level registration token to use during runner setup.

share_with_group_lock.description: Boolean, defaults to false.  Prevent sharing

visibility_level.description: The group's visibility. Can be `private`, `internal`, or `public`.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage GitLab groups.
Note your provider will need to be configured with admin-level access for this resource to work.

access_level.description: The access level for the group access token. Valid values are: `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`.

active.description: True if the token is active.

created_at.description: Time the token has been created, RFC3339 format.

expires_at.description: The token expires at midnight UTC on that date. The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Default is never.

group.description: The ID or path of the group to add the group access token to.

name.description: The name of the group access token.

revoked.description: True if the token is revoked.

scopes.description: The scope for the group access token. It determines the actions which can be performed when authenticating with this token. Valid values are: `api`, `read_api`, `read_registry`, `write_registry`, `read_repository`, `write_repository`.

token.description: The group access token. This is only populated when creating a new group access token. This attribute is not available for imported resources.

user_id.description: The user id associated to the token.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage Group Access Token for your GitLab Groups. (Introduced in GitLab 14.7)

group.description: The id of the group to add the badge to.

image_url.description: The image url which will be presented on group overview.

link_url.description: The url linked with the badge.

rendered_image_url.description: The image_url argument rendered (in case of use of placeholders).

rendered_link_url.description: The link_url argument rendered (in case of use of placeholders).

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage badges for your GitLab groups.
For further information, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/badges.html#group-badges).

domain.description: The base domain of the cluster.

enabled.description: Determines if cluster is active or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

environment_scope.description: The associated environment to the cluster. Defaults to `*`.

group.description: The id of the group to add the cluster to.

kubernetes_api_url.description: The URL to access the Kubernetes API.

kubernetes_authorization_type.description: The cluster authorization type. Valid values are `rbac`, `abac`, `unknown_authorization`. Defaults to `rbac`.

kubernetes_ca_cert.description: TLS certificate (needed if API is using a self-signed TLS certificate).

kubernetes_token.description: The token to authenticate against Kubernetes.

managed.description: Determines if cluster is managed by gitlab or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

management_project_id.description: The ID of the management project for the cluster.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage group clusters for your GitLab groups.
For further information on clusters, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/group/clusters/index.html).
This resource allows you to set custom attributes for a group.

color.description: The color of the label given in 6-digit hex notation with leading '#' sign (e.g. #FFAABB) or one of the [CSS color names](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#Color_keywords).

group.description: The name or id of the group to add the label to.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage labels for your GitLab groups.
For further information on labels, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/labels.html#group-labels).

access_level.description: Minimum access level for members of the LDAP group. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `owner`, `master`

cn.description: The CN of the LDAP group to link with.

force.description: If true, then delete and replace an existing LDAP link if one exists.

group_access.description: Minimum access level for members of the LDAP group. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `owner`, `master`

group_id.description: The id of the GitLab group.

ldap_provider.description: The name of the LDAP provider as stored in the GitLab database.

block.description: This resource allows you to add an LDAP link to an existing GitLab group.

access_level.description: Access level for the member. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `owner`, `master`.

expires_at.description: Expiration date for the group membership. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`

block.description: This resource allows you to add a user to an existing group.

group_access.description: The access level to grant the group. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `owner`, `master`

group_id.description: The id of the main group.

share_group_id.description: The id of an additional group which will be shared with the main group.

block.description: This resource allows you to share a group with another group

environment_scope.description: The environment scope of the variable. Defaults to all environment (`*`). Note that in Community Editions of Gitlab, values other than `*` will cause inconsistent plans. See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/variables/#add-a-cicd-variable-to-a-group

group.description: The name or id of the group.

masked.description: If set to `true`, the value of the variable will be hidden in job logs. The value must meet the [masking requirements](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/variables/#masked-variables). Defaults to `false`.

protected.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.

variable_type.description: The type of a variable. Available types are: env_var (default) and file.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage CI/CD variables for your GitLab groups.
For further information on variables, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/ci/variables/README.html#variables).

domain.description: The base domain of the cluster.

enabled.description: Determines if cluster is active or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

environment_scope.description: The associated environment to the cluster. Defaults to `*`.

kubernetes_api_url.description: The URL to access the Kubernetes API.

kubernetes_authorization_type.description: The cluster authorization type. Valid values are `rbac`, `abac`, `unknown_authorization`. Defaults to `rbac`.

kubernetes_ca_cert.description: TLS certificate (needed if API is using a self-signed TLS certificate).

kubernetes_namespace.description: The unique namespace related to the instance.

kubernetes_token.description: The token to authenticate against Kubernetes. This attribute cannot be read.

managed.description: Determines if cluster is managed by gitlab or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

management_project_id.description: The ID of the management project for the cluster.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage instance clusters for your GitLab instances.
For further information on clusters, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/instance/clusters/).

masked.description: If set to `true`, the value of the variable will be hidden in job logs. The value must meet the [masking requirements](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/variables/#masked-variable-requirements). Defaults to `false`.

protected.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.

variable_type.description: The type of a variable. Available types are: env_var (default) and file.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage CI/CD variables for your GitLab instance.
For further information on variables, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/instance_level_ci_variables.html).

color.description: The color of the label given in 6-digit hex notation with leading '#' sign (e.g. #FFAABB) or one of the [CSS color names](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#Color_keywords).

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the label to.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage labels for your GitLab projects.
For further information on labels, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/labels.html#project-labels).

approval_status.description: Whether the license is approved or not. Only 'approved' or 'blacklisted' allowed.

name.description: The name of the managed license (I.e., 'Apache License 2.0' or 'MIT license')

project.description: The ID of the project under which the managed license will be created.

block.description:
This resource allows you to add rules for managing licenses on a project.
For additional information, please see the [gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/compliance/license_compliance/).

~> Using this resource requires an active [gitlab ultimate](https://about.gitlab.com/pricing/)subscription.

active.description: The activation of pipeline schedule. If false is set, the pipeline schedule will deactivated initially.

description.description: The description of the pipeline schedule.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the schedule to.

ref.description: The branch/tag name to be triggered.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage pipeline schedules.
For further information on clusters, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/pipelines/schedules.html).

pipeline_schedule_id.description: The id of the pipeline schedule.

project.description: The id of the project to add the schedule to.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage variables for pipeline schedules.

description.description: The description of the pipeline trigger.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the trigger to.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage pipeline triggers

allow_merge_on_skipped_pipeline.description: Set to true if you want to treat skipped pipelines as if they finished with success.

approvals_before_merge.description: Number of merge request approvals required for merging. Default is 0.

archive_on_destroy.description: Set to `true` to archive the project instead of deleting on destroy. If set to `true` it will entire omit the `DELETE` operation.

archived.description: Whether the project is in read-only mode (archived). Repositories can be archived/unarchived by toggling this parameter.

build_coverage_regex.description: Test coverage parsing for the project.

ci_config_path.description: Custom Path to CI config file.

ci_forward_deployment_enabled.description: When a new deployment job starts, skip older deployment jobs that are still pending.

container_registry_enabled.description: Enable container registry for the project.

default_branch.description: The default branch for the project.

group_with_project_templates_id.description: For group-level custom templates, specifies ID of group from which all the custom project templates are sourced. Leave empty for instance-level templates. Requires use_custom_template to be true (enterprise edition).

http_url_to_repo.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the

import_url.description: Git URL to a repository to be imported.

initialize_with_readme.description: Create main branch with first commit containing a README.md file.

issues_enabled.description: Enable issue tracking for the project.

issues_template.description: Sets the template for new issues in the project.

merge_method.description: Set to `ff` to create fast-forward merges

merge_requests_enabled.description: Enable merge requests for the project.

merge_requests_template.description: Sets the template for new merge requests in the project.

merge_trains_enabled.description: Enable or disable merge trains. Requires `merge_pipelines_enabled` to be set to `true` to take effect.

mirror_overwrites_diverged_branches.description: Enable overwrite diverged branches for a mirrored project.

mirror_trigger_builds.description: Enable trigger builds on pushes for a mirrored project.

namespace_id.description: The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user.

only_allow_merge_if_all_discussions_are_.description: Set to true if you want allow merges only if all discussions are resolved.

only_allow_merge_if_pipeline_succeeds.description: Set to true if you want allow merges only if a pipeline succeeds.

only_mirror_protected_branches.description: Enable only mirror protected branches for a mirrored project.

packages_enabled.description: Enable packages repository for the project.

path_with_namespace.description: The path of the repository with namespace.

printing_merge_request_link_enabled.description: Show link to create/view merge request when pushing from the command line

remove_source_branch_after_merge.description: Enable `Delete source branch` option by default for all new merge requests.

request_access_enabled.description: Allow users to request member access.

runners_token.description: Registration token to use during runner setup.

shared_runners_enabled.description: Enable shared runners for this project.

squash_option.description: Squash commits when merge request. Valid values are `never`, `always`, `default_on`, or `default_off`. The default value is `default_off`. [GitLab >= 14.1]

ssh_url_to_repo.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the

template_name.description: When used without use_custom_template, name of a built-in project template. When used with use_custom_template, name of a custom project template. This option is mutually exclusive with `template_project_id`.

template_project_id.description: When used with use_custom_template, project ID of a custom project template. This is preferable to using template_name since template_name may be ambiguous (enterprise edition). This option is mutually exclusive with `template_name`.

use_custom_template.description: Use either custom instance or group (with group_with_project_templates_id) project template (enterprise edition).

visibility_level.description: Set to `public` to create a public project.

web_url.description: URL that can be used to find the project in a browser.

author_email_regex.description: All commit author emails must match this regex, e.g. `@my-company.com$`.

branch_name_regex.description: All branch names must match this regex, e.g. `(feature|hotfix)\/*`.

commit_committer_check.description: Users can only push commits to this repository that were committed with one of their own verified emails.

commit_message_negative_regex.description: No commit message is allowed to match this regex, for example `ssh\:\/\/`.

commit_message_regex.description: All commit messages must match this regex, e.g. `Fixed \d+\..*`.

file_name_regex.description: All commited filenames must not match this regex, e.g. `(jar|exe)$`.

member_check.description: Restrict commits by author (email) to existing GitLab users.

prevent_secrets.description: GitLab will reject any files that are likely to contain secrets.

reject_unsigned_commits.description: Reject commit when it’s not signed through GPG.

block.description: Push rules for the project.
This resource allows you to create and manage projects within your GitLab group or within your user.

active.description: True if the token is active.

created_at.description: Time the token has been created, RFC3339 format.

expires_at.description: Time the token will expire it, YYYY-MM-DD format. Will not expire per default.

name.description: A name to describe the project access token.

project.description: The id of the project to add the project access token to.

revoked.description: True if the token is revoked.

token.description: The secret token. This is only populated when creating a new project access token.

user_id.description: The user_id associated to the token.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage Project Access Token for your GitLab projects.

approvals_required.description: The number of approvals required for this rule.

group_ids.description: A list of group IDs whose members can approve of the merge request.

name.description: The name of the approval rule.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the approval rules.

protected_branch_ids.description: A list of protected branch IDs (not branch names) for which the rule applies.

user_ids.description: A list of specific User IDs to add to the list of approvers.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage multiple approval rules for your GitLab projects. For further information on approval rules, consult the [gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/merge_request_approvals.html#project-level-mr-approvals).

-> This feature requires GitLab Premium.

image_url.description: The image url which will be presented on project overview.

link_url.description: The url linked with the badge.

project.description: The id of the project to add the badge to.

rendered_image_url.description: The image_url argument rendered (in case of use of placeholders).

rendered_link_url.description: The link_url argument rendered (in case of use of placeholders).

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage badges for your GitLab projects.
For further information consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/badges.html).

domain.description: The base domain of the cluster.

enabled.description: Determines if cluster is active or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

environment_scope.description: The associated environment to the cluster. Defaults to `*`.

kubernetes_api_url.description: The URL to access the Kubernetes API.

kubernetes_authorization_type.description: The cluster authorization type. Valid values are `rbac`, `abac`, `unknown_authorization`. Defaults to `rbac`.

kubernetes_ca_cert.description: TLS certificate (needed if API is using a self-signed TLS certificate).

kubernetes_namespace.description: The unique namespace related to the project.

kubernetes_token.description: The token to authenticate against Kubernetes.

managed.description: Determines if cluster is managed by gitlab or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

management_project_id.description: The ID of the management project for the cluster.

project.description: The id of the project to add the cluster to.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage project clusters for your GitLab projects.
For further information on clusters, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/clusters/index.html).

project.description: The id of the project.

block.description: This resource allows you to set custom attributes for a project.

freeze_end.description: End of the Freeze Period in cron format (e.g. `0 2 * * *`).

freeze_start.description: Start of the Freeze Period in cron format (e.g. `0 1 * * *`).

project_id.description: The id of the project to add the schedule to.

block.description: This resource allows you to create and manage freeze periods. For further information on freeze periods, consult the [gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/freeze_periods.html#create-a-freeze-period).

confidential_issues_events.description: Invoke the hook for confidential issues events.

confidential_note_events.description: Invoke the hook for confidential notes events.

deployment_events.description: Invoke the hook for deployment events.

enable_ssl_verification.description: Enable ssl verification when invoking the hook.

issues_events.description: Invoke the hook for issues events.

job_events.description: Invoke the hook for job events.

merge_requests_events.description: Invoke the hook for merge requests.

note_events.description: Invoke the hook for notes events.

pipeline_events.description: Invoke the hook for pipeline events.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the hook to.

push_events.description: Invoke the hook for push events.

push_events_branch_filter.description: Invoke the hook for push events on matching branches only.

releases_events.description: Invoke the hook for releases events.

tag_push_events.description: Invoke the hook for tag push events.

token.description: A token to present when invoking the hook.

url.description: The url of the hook to invoke.

wiki_page_events.description: Invoke the hook for wiki page events.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage hooks for your GitLab projects.
For further information on hooks, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/integrations/webhooks.html).

disable_overriding_approvers_per_merge_r.description: By default, users are able to edit the approval rules in merge requests. If set to true,

merge_requests_author_approval.description: Set to `true` if you want to allow merge request authors to self-approve merge requests. Authors

merge_requests_disable_committers_approv.description: Set to `true` if you want to prevent approval of merge requests by merge request committers.

project_id.description: The ID of the project to change MR approval configuration.

require_password_to_approve.description: Set to `true` if you want to require authentication when approving a merge request.

reset_approvals_on_push.description: Set to `true` if you want to remove all approvals in a merge request when new commits are pushed to its source branch. Default is `true`.

block.description:
This resource allows you to configure project-level MR approvals. for your GitLab projects.
For further information on merge request approvals, consult the [GitLab API documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/merge_request_approvals.html#project-level-mr-approvals).

access_level.description: The access level for the member. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `master`

block.description: This resource allows you to add a current user to an existing project with a set access level.

enabled.description: Determines if the mirror is enabled.

keep_divergent_refs.description: Determines if divergent refs are skipped.

only_protected_branches.description: Determines if only protected branches are mirrored.

project.description: The id of the project.

url.description: The URL of the remote repository to be mirrored.

block.description:
This resource allows you to add a mirror target for the repository, all changes will be synced to the remote target.

-> This is for *pushing* changes to a remote repository. *Pull Mirroring* can be configured using a combination of the
`import_url`, `mirror`, and `mirror_trigger_builds` properties on the `gitlab_project` resource.

For further information on mirroring, consult the
[gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/repository/repository_mirroring.html#repository-mirroring).

access_level.description: The access level to grant the group for the project. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `master`

group_access.description: The access level to grant the group for the project. Valid values are: `no one`, `minimal`, `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `master`

block.description: This resource allows you to share a project with a group

environment_scope.description: The environment_scope of the variable. Defaults to `*`.

masked.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be masked if it would have been written to the logs. Defaults to `false`.

project.description: The name or id of the project.

protected.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.

variable_type.description: The type of a variable. Available types are: env_var (default) and file.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage CI/CD variables for your GitLab projects.
For further information on variables, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/ci/variables/README.html#variables).

~> **Important:** If your GitLab version is older than 13.4, you may see nondeterministic behavior
when updating or deleting `gitlab_project_variable` resources with non-unique keys, for example if
there is another variable with the same key and different environment scope. See
[this GitLab issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/9912).

branch.description: Name of the branch to which to commit to.

content.description: base64 encoded file content. No other encoding is currently supported, because of a [GitLab API bug](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342430).

file_path.description: The full path of the file. It must be relative to the root of the project without a leading slash `/`.

project.description: The ID of the project.

start_branch.description: Name of the branch to start the new commit from.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage GitLab repository files.

**Limitations**:

The [GitLab Repository Files API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/repository_files.html)
can only create, update or delete a single file at the time.
The API will also
[fail with a `400`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/repository_files.html#update-existing-file-in-repository)
response status code if the underlying repository is changed while the API tries to make changes.
Therefore, it's recommended to make sure that you execute it with
[`-parallelism=1`](https://www.terraform.io/docs/cli/commands/apply.html#parallelism-n)
and that no other entity than the terraform at hand makes changes to the
underlying repository while it's executing.

project.description: ID of the project you want to activate integration on.

repository_url.description: The URL of the GitHub repo to integrate with, e,g, https://github.com/gitlabhq/terraform-provider-gitlab.

static_context.description: Append instance name instead of branch to the status. Must enable to set a GitLab status check as _required_ in GitHub. See [Static / dynamic status check names] to learn more.

token.description: A GitHub personal access token with at least `repo:status` scope.

block.description:
**NOTE**: requires either EE (self-hosted) or Silver and above (GitLab.com).

This resource manages a [GitHub integration](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/github.html) that updates pipeline statuses on a GitHub repo's pull requests.

api_url.description: The base URL to the Jira instance API. Web URL value is used if not set. For example, https://jira-api.example.com.

comment_on_event_enabled.description: Enable comments inside Jira issues on each GitLab event (commit / merge request)

jira_issue_transition_id.description: The ID of a transition that moves issues to a closed state. You can find this number under the JIRA workflow administration (Administration > Issues > Workflows) by selecting View under Operations of the desired workflow of your project. By default, this ID is set to 2.

merge_requests_events.description: Enable notifications for merge request events

password.description: The password of the user created to be used with GitLab/JIRA.

project.description: ID of the project you want to activate integration on.

project_key.description: The short identifier for your JIRA project, all uppercase, e.g., PROJ.

url.description: The URL to the JIRA project which is being linked to this GitLab project. For example, https://jira.example.com.

username.description: The username of the user created to be used with GitLab/JIRA.

block.description: This resource allows you to manage Jira integration.

branches_to_be_notified.description: Branches to send notifications for. Valid options are “all”, “default”, “protected”, and “default_and_protected”. The default value is “default”

confidential_issues_events.description: Enable notifications for confidential issue events

confidential_note_events.description: Enable notifications for confidential note events

merge_requests_events.description: Enable notifications for merge request events

project.description: ID of the project you want to activate integration on.

tag_push_events.description: Enable notifications for tag push events

webhook.description: The Microsoft Teams webhook. For example, https://outlook.office.com/webhook/...

wiki_page_events.description: Enable notifications for wiki page events

block.description: This resource allows you to manage Microsoft Teams integration.

branches_to_be_notified.description: Branches to send notifications for. Valid options are `all`, `default`, `protected`, and `default_and_protected`. Default is `default`

notify_only_broken_pipelines.description: Notify only broken pipelines. Default is true.

project.description: ID of the project you want to activate integration on.

recipients.description: ) email addresses where notifications are sent.

block.description: This resource manages a [Pipelines email integration](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/overview.html#integrations-listing) that emails the pipeline status to a list of recipients.

branches_to_be_notified.description: Branches to send notifications for. Valid options are "all", "default", "protected", and "default_and_protected".

confidential_issue_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive confidential issue events notifications.

confidential_issues_events.description: Enable notifications for confidential issues events.

confidential_note_events.description: Enable notifications for confidential note events.

issue_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive issue events notifications.

job_events.description: Enable notifications for job events. **ATTENTION**: This attribute is currently not being submitted to the GitLab API, due to https://github.com/xanzy/go-gitlab/issues/1354.

merge_request_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive merge request events notifications.

merge_requests_events.description: Enable notifications for merge requests events.

note_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive note events notifications.

notify_only_default_branch.description: This parameter has been replaced with `branches_to_be_notified`.

pipeline_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive pipeline events notifications.

project.description: ID of the project you want to activate integration on.

push_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive push events notifications.

tag_push_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive tag push events notifications.

tag_push_events.description: Enable notifications for tag push events.

wiki_page_channel.description: The name of the channel to receive wiki page events notifications.

wiki_page_events.description: Enable notifications for wiki page events.

block.description: This resource allows you to manage Slack notifications integration.

create_access_level.description: Access levels which are allowed to create. Valid values are: `no one`, `developer`, `maintainer`.

project.description: The id of the project.

tag.description: Name of the tag or wildcard.

block.description: This resource allows you to protect a specific tag or wildcard by an access level so that the user with less access level cannot Create the tags.

soft_destroy.description: Empty the topics fields instead of deleting it

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage topics that are then assignable to projects. Topics are the successors for project tags. Aside from avoiding terminology collisions with Git tags, they are more descriptive and better searchable.  

For assigning topics, use the [project](./project.md) resource.

~> Deleting a resource doesn't delete the corresponding topic as the GitLab API doesn't support deleting topics yet. You can set soft_destroy to true if you want the topics description to be emptied instead.

can_create_group.description: Boolean, defaults to false. Whether to allow the user to create groups.

email.description: The e-mail address of the user.

is_admin.description: Boolean, defaults to false.  Whether to enable administrative privileges

is_external.description: Boolean, defaults to false. Whether a user has access only to some internal or private projects. External users can only access projects to which they are explicitly granted access.

note.description: The note associated to the user.

projects_limit.description: Integer, defaults to 0.  Number of projects user can create.

reset_password.description: Boolean, defaults to false. Send user password reset link.

skip_confirmation.description: Boolean, defaults to true. Whether to skip confirmation.

state.description: String, defaults to 'active'. The state of the user account. Valid values are `active`, `deactivated`, `blocked`.

block.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage GitLab users.
Note your provider will need to be configured with admin-level access for this resource to work.

-> You must specify either `password` or `reset_password`.
This resource allows you to set custom attributes for a user.

created_at.description: The time when this key was created in GitLab.

expires_at.description: The expiration date of the SSH key in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

key.description: The ssh key. The SSH key `comment` (trailing part) is optional and ignored for diffing, because GitLab overrides it with the username and GitLab hostname.

key_id.description: The ID of the ssh key.

title.description: The title of the ssh key.

user_id.description: The ID of the user to add the ssh key to.

block.description:
This resource allows to manage GitLab user SSH keys.

**Upstream API**: [GitLab API docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/users.html#single-ssh-key)

can_push.description: Bool, true if you can push to the branch.

commit.description: The commit associated with the branch ref.

default.description: Bool, true if branch is the default branch for the project.

developer_can_merge.description: Bool, true if developer level access allows to merge branch.

developer_can_push.description: Bool, true if developer level access allows git push.

merged.description: Bool, true if the branch has been merged into it's parent.

project.description: The full path or id of the project.

protected.description: Bool, true if branch has branch protection.

web_url.description: The url of the created branch (https.)

block.description: Provide details about a gitlab project branch

default_branch_protection.description: Whether developers and maintainers can push to the applicable default branch.

full_name.description: The full name of the group.

full_path.description: The full path of the group.

lfs_enabled.description: Boolean, is LFS enabled for projects in this group.

parent_id.description: Integer, ID of the parent group.

request_access_enabled.description: Boolean, is request for access enabled to the group.

runners_token.description: The group level registration token to use during runner setup.

visibility_level.description: Visibility level of the group. Possible values are `private`, `internal`, `public`.

block.description:
Provide details about a specific group in the gitlab provider.

> **Note**: exactly one of group_id or full_path must be provided.

access_level.description: Only return members with the desired access level. Acceptable values are: `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `owner`.

full_path.description: The full path of the group.

block.description:
Provide details about a list of group members in the gitlab provider. The results include id, username, name and more about the requested members.

> **Note**: exactly one of group_id or full_path must be provided.

archived.description: Whether the project is in read-only mode (archived).

default_branch.description: The default branch for the project.

http_url_to_repo.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the

id.description: The integer or path with namespace that uniquely identifies the project within the gitlab install.

issues_enabled.description: Enable issue tracking for the project.

merge_requests_enabled.description: Enable merge requests for the project.

namespace_id.description: The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user.

path_with_namespace.description: The path of the repository with namespace.

printing_merge_request_link_enabled.description: Show link to create/view merge request when pushing from the command line

remove_source_branch_after_merge.description: Enable `Delete source branch` option by default for all new merge requests

request_access_enabled.description: Allow users to request member access.

runners_token.description: Registration token to use during runner setup.

ssh_url_to_repo.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the

visibility_level.description: Repositories are created as private by default.

web_url.description: URL that can be used to find the project in a browser.

block.description: Provide details about a specific project in the gitlab provider. The results include the name of the project, path, description, default branch, etc.

code_owner_approval_required.description: Reject code pushes that change files listed in the CODEOWNERS file.

merge_access_levels.description: Describes which access levels, users, or groups are allowed to perform the action.

name.description: The name of the protected branch.

project_id.description: The integer or path with namespace that uniquely identifies the project.

push_access_levels.description: Describes which access levels, users, or groups are allowed to perform the action.

block.description: Provides details about a specific protected branch in a given project.

project_id.description: The integer or path with namespace that uniquely identifies the project.

protected_branches.description: A list of protected branches, as defined below.

block.description: Provides details about all protected branches in a given project.

group_id.description: The ID of the group owned by the authenticated user to look projects for within. Cannot be used with `min_access_level`, `with_programming_language` or `statistics`.

include_subgroups.description: Include projects in subgroups of this group. Default is `false`. Needs `group_id`.

max_queryable_pages.description: The maximum number of project results pages that may be queried. Prevents overloading your Gitlab instance in case of a misconfiguration.

membership.description: Limit by projects that the current user is a member of.

min_access_level.description: Limit to projects where current user has at least this access level, refer to the [official documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/members.html) for values. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

order_by.description: Return projects ordered by `id`, `name`, `path`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, or `last_activity_at` fields. Default is `created_at`.

owned.description: Limit by projects owned by the current user.

page.description: The first page to begin the query on.

per_page.description: The number of results to return per page.

projects.description: A list containing the projects matching the supplied arguments

search.description: Return list of authorized projects matching the search criteria.

simple.description: Return only the ID, URL, name, and path of each project.

sort.description: Return projects sorted in `asc` or `desc` order. Default is `desc`.

starred.description: Limit by projects starred by the current user.

statistics.description: Include project statistics. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

with_custom_attributes.description: Include custom attributes in response _(admins only)_.

with_issues_enabled.description: Limit by projects with issues feature enabled. Default is `false`.

with_merge_requests_enabled.description: Limit by projects with merge requests feature enabled. Default is `false`.

with_programming_language.description: Limit by projects which use the given programming language. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

with_shared.description: Include projects shared to this group. Default is `true`. Needs `group_id`.

block.description:
Provide details about a list of projects in the Gitlab provider. Listing all projects and group projects with [project filtering](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/projects.html#list-user-projects) or [group project filtering](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/groups.html#list-a-groups-projects) is supported.

> **NOTE**: This data source supports all available filters exposed by the `xanzy/go-gitlab` package, which might not expose all available filters exposed by the Gitlab APIs.

> **NOTE**: The [owner sub-attributes](#nestedobjatt--projects--owner) are only populated if the Gitlab token used has an administrator scope.

avatar_url.description: The avatar URL of the user.

can_create_group.description: Whether the user can create groups.

can_create_project.description: Whether the user can create projects.

created_at.description: Date the user was created at.

email.description: The public email address of the user. **Note**: before GitLab 14.8 the lookup was based on the users primary email address.

extern_uid.description: The external UID of the user.

is_admin.description: Whether the user is an admin.

projects_limit.description: Number of projects the user can create.

state.description: Whether the user is active or blocked.

two_factor_enabled.description: Whether user's two-factor auth is enabled.

user_provider.description: The UID provider of the user.

block.description:
Provide details about a specific user in the gitlab provider. Especially the ability to lookup the id for linking to other resources.

-> Some attributes might not be returned depending on if you're an admin or not. Please refer to [Gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/api/users.html#single-user) for more details.

created_after.description: Search for users created after a specific date. (Requires administrator privileges)

created_before.description: Search for users created before a specific date. (Requires administrator privileges)

extern_provider.description: Lookup users by external provider. (Requires administrator privileges)

extern_uid.description: Lookup users by external UID. (Requires administrator privileges)

order_by.description: Order the users' list by `id`, `name`, `username`, `created_at` or `updated_at`. (Requires administrator privileges)

search.description: Search users by username, name or email.

sort.description: Sort users' list in asc or desc order. (Requires administrator privileges)

block.description:
Provide details about a list of users in the gitlab provider. The results include id, username, email, name and more about the requested users. Users can also be sorted and filtered using several options.

**NOTE**: Some available options require administrator privileges. Please visit [Gitlab API documentation][users_for_admins] for more information.
